  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3474&action=edit>
Additional JDK search path

The attached patch was submitted to me (and r-devel in the same email) for the
Debian package which failed to build proper Java support on loong64 (but also
on mipsel64 and others, there is an open bug report at [bug
1103373](<https://bugs.debian.org/1103373>). I am filing it as a courtesy so that
it enters the BTS here too.

text:
*[Bug 18884] Additional JDK directory required for build on loong64*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18884>

Simon Urbanek (<mailto:simon.urbanek@r-project.org|simon.urbanek@r-project.org>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|NEW                         |ASSIGNED
                 CC|                            |simon.urbanek@r-project.org

--- Comment #3 from Simon Urbanek (<mailto:simon.urbanek@r-project.org|simon.urbanek@r-project.org>) ---
Thanks! I'll take care of it.

For posterity, if JDK adds a new variant it has to be added manually to
`javareconf` to recognize it. In JDK sources the variants are in
`make/autoconf/hotspot.m4`[1] defined in JDK 24u as follows:

    VALID_JVM_VARIANTS="server client minimal core zero custom"

From the PR[2] that added `zero` it appears that `core` and `custom` are not
used for releases. 

[1] -
<https://github.com/openjdk/jdk24u/blob/master/make/autoconf/hotspot.m4#L27>
[2] - <https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/pull/5440>

Note that if a new variant is added, it would be good to also notify rJava,
because dynamic loading has to also search the variant directories since they
may be different from the time when R was configured.

text:
*[Bug 18884] Additional JDK directory required for build on loong64*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18884>

--- Comment #7 from Dirk Eddelbuettel (<mailto:edd@debian.org|edd@debian.org>) ---
Simon, 

You misunderstand slight what we do here . We have the ability to hold per
package patches in the (source) directory `debian/patches/`.  Given that I had
the patch before that is where it went.  For your reference you can always look
at our
[debian/changelog](<https://sources.debian.org/src/r-base/4.5.0-2/debian/changelog/>)
and you can of course also peruse the [git
repository](<https://salsa.debian.org/edd/r-base>) or peruse the code via the
[web view](<https://sources.debian.org/src/r-base/4.5.0-2/>) (here tagged to
4.5.0-2).

The changelog entry was

```
r-base (4.5.0-2) unstable; urgency=medium

  * debian/control: Add libzstd-dev to Depends of r-base-dev 

  * debian/patches/libjvm.so-for-zero-build.patch: Support additional JDK
    location needed on loong64

 -- Dirk Eddelbuettel <edd@debian.org>  Thu, 17 Apr 2025 07:00:09 -0500

```

Hope this helps. Feel free to reach out if anything is unclear.

--- Comment #8 from Simon Urbanek (<mailto:simon.urbanek@r-project.org|simon.urbanek@r-project.org>) ---
Dirk, you're in the wrong bug system - here we handle R bug reports. What you
do in Debian is irrelevant and your business - please discuss those issues in
the Debian bug system. All I asked was to report if r88154 fixes this issue you
reported here so it can be ported to R 4.5.0 Patched. Whether or how you add it
to Debian is your call, but I did check you you did NOT include it in the
4.5.0-2 patch set so it is not relevant here.

text:
*[Bug 18884] Additional JDK directory required for build on loong64*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18884>

--- Comment #9 from Dirk Eddelbuettel (<mailto:edd@debian.org|edd@debian.org>) ---
Simon,

We (Debian) had a built fail (on a platform few of us and none of R Core, I
surmise, have access to). 

A patch was developed by Dandan who tested it under Debian's build system (all
of which leaves R pretty pristine). He sent it to both of us, I applied it, and
built with it.

Now you ask: please report if it works. Dandan sent you a working and tested
patch, I reported further success on different hardware platforms. That is what
you asked for. No more no less.

text:
*[Bug 18884] Additional JDK directory required for build on loong64*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18884>

--- Comment #11 from Dirk Eddelbuettel (<mailto:edd@debian.org|edd@debian.org>) ---
I do not run a test build server for you.  If you chose to change the patch you
got, well then it is now yours. I am not going to upload to thirteen different
build systems for you on your whim. I look after a "production build" of the
released R, which was repaired with a tested patch. I reconfirm that it works.
That is my part in this saga.  R 4.5.0 was released with borked JVM config on
loong64, and likely armel and mips64. The loong64 patch seems to address it. 
My work ends here.

You are obviously entirely in your right to change that patch again. But you
cannot expect me to test your new modifications for you. They are yours. 

I reported to you what worked for us. Again, no more, no less.  Have fun now, I
will withdraw from this rather pointless conversation.
